trialTitle: Neratinib and Xeloda for Metastatic HER2+ Breast Cancer
scientificTitle: Phase Ib/II Study of Capecitabine 7/7 Schedule With Neratinib in Patients With Metastatic HER2-Positive Breast Cancer (NCT03377387)
purpose: To study the safety and effects (good and bad) of using a targeted therapy in combination with different doses of a standard chemotherapy.
whoIsThisFor: Women with HER2 positive metastatic (stage IV) breast cancer who have received prior Herceptin. You may have had up to 4 prior regimens of chemotherapy
whatIsInvolved:
You will receive the following:

  • Capacitabine (Xeloda速), by mouth, daily (1 week on, 1 week off)
  • Neratinib (Nerlynx速), by mouth daily
whatIsBeingStudied:
The targeted therapy that is being used in this study is neratinib (Nerlynx速). It is approved to treat certain patients with HER2+ early-stage breast cancer.

  • Capacitabine (Xeloda速) is approved by the FDA for treating advanced breast cancer.
